https://sfbay.craigslist.org/eby/apa/551.features:
Open House this Sunday 2-4 PM and also shown by appointment.

This approx. 1601-square-foot live/work artist's loft is located in the historic Clawson School built in 1917. The pride of Oakland's school system for 52 years, this grand building features art deco brick-and-molded-terracotta facade detail rare to find in a residential setting. This ground-floor loft features high ceilings throughout with upgraded architectural design features like a raised bamboo floor, corrugated aluminum siding in spots and a flowing waterfall which can give a zen-like feel and sound, among others. With its large double-paned windows and the beautiful daytime natural light creates the perfect atmosphere for a creative tenant. The very large main space includes an ample, well-equipped kitchen and dining area. The large bathroom has a shower/tub combo, washer and dryer. 

Create your own living layout in this spacious unit that is plenty large enough for a couple. No one is living below, above or around you in the large main space, which gives you the freedom to work late, make noise or watch movies at any hour of the night, making this a truly unique environment. There is simply nothing like it on the market now. Right above, a virtually private deck enables you to sit or barbecue outdoors. There are windows on three sides that allow a sweet marine bay cross-breeze if opened, never getting too hot in summer. Just outside, apple, peach and Asian pears produce fruit in season and lemon trees offer their bounty year-round. There are three common area outside decks that can be used by anyone. This unit has tons of soul and emits creative energy from the solid concrete that housed young children learning and at play for 60 years! They can't build buildings like this anymore. 

The 28-unit building houses an artist/young professional community and the unit itself was previously occupied by a renown artist. Looking for a tenant who loves this space, is responsible, and will enjoy being part of this vibrant community.

Includes:
- water, garbage and sewer 
- washer and dryer in unit
- brand new stainless steel refrigerator
- microwave oven
- brand new semi-pro gas range and oven
- Bosch "quiet" dishwasher
- Cuisinart coffee machine
- garbage disposal
- central gas heating
- double-paned windows
- dehumidifier
- one convenient secure parking space in back lot
- additional parking in front lot
- large closet
- gate clicker
- pest control
- running water fall 
- ceiling fan
- IKEA wardrobe x4

Pets are negotiable. . .

Location:
- 3240 Peralta St. Unit #1
- access to I-80, I-580, CA-24 I-880 and the Bay bridge are just blocks away.
- a few blocks from major shopping: Home Depot, Ikea, Target, Best Buy, AMC, 
Emery Bay Mall, Safeway, Trader Joe's, Starbucks, etc.
- on Emeryville-West Oakland border - a few blocks from the Pixar campus
- minutes from West Oakland Bart and SF is 12 minutes away from there

Terms:
- Available April 1st, 2016
- 1 year lease
- Rent = monthly @ $3640
- Security deposit $4500
- No cigarette smoking
- Renter's insurance required
- No sublets
- Must follow WCL HOA CC&Rs and Rules
- $100 move in/out fee.
- $25 application fee

Please reply to this post if you would like to see this listing and make an appointment to see it or have questions. The $25 application fee will be waived if a current credit report (within 2 weeks) is provided by applicants. 


Some more info on history of the building:
In 1971, Clawson was the center of Superintendent Marcus Foster's partnership with UC Berkeley working to improve education for low-income students. In the mid-1970's, the building became Oakland's foray into creating a public school dedicated to the arts. Dogtown Developers purchased the building from Oakland Unified School District in 1999, after it closed in 1979, and renovated it to create these unique and amazing live/work lofts.

Shown by appointment.

A true gem this charming one + bedrooom, furnished, 700+ square foot, two-story cottage is available June 1. Nestled in a large back yard with its own patio, it is a five block walk to Cal and a 15 minute walk to BART (a 5 minute bus ride).

In the past visiting scholars, professionals and graduate student couples have found the cottage a perfect fit. Those who have lived in SF find they get twice the space and yard for what they would pay in the City. The upstairs has 1 bedroom which opens onto a plus room that can be used as a study, for guest stays or another bedroom. While the plus room has been used for a bedroom it does not have a door. The cottage cannot accommodate more than three people. Ads for more than that will not be answered. One or two people are the ideal fit.

The house has a highly functional layout including a dining room, living room, full kitchen, private laundry room with washer/dryer, extra storage areas, and a patio. The living room currently has a daybed/couch that is perfect for guests staying over. The patio deck is surrounded by greenery. You can study, relax or have friends over. 

Depending on length of stay, the cottage can come completely furnished, including dishes and pots and pans, this renovated cottage is indeed a rare find. Economize, as you won't have to spend the time or energy on furnishings. This is especially advantageous if you don't have a car to carry large furniture.

Formerly the owner's home, the cottage is deceptively rustic. Beneath the charm are all new plumbing and electrical. The living room has a porcelain gas heater that is not only a charming period heater but is inexpensive to run and state of the art in providing heat. This cottage is particularly nice as it's off the street and located in a large back yard with a magnificent oak tree. A larger Edwardian home occupies the front of the property. 

The residents in the front house are mostly grad students and postdocs. It's very homey yet private. The people here are responsible without being picky; respectful, especially of study time, but social. Dinner parties are common but no big parties (10 people or more) or loud events out of respect for the restored house, neighbors and the good chance that one would get fined by BPD (now up to $750) for a loud party.

The house is located in the south of campus between the Elmwood and the Telegraph areas. You can walk south a couple of blocks and be in the upscale Elmwood or a few blocks north and be in the University/Telegraph area. You can catch a bus by walking two blocks either way. As mentioned, BART (the subway) is about a 15 minute walk. 

This is a University neighborhood with fairly high density. The cottage is surrounded by greenery and private but there are tall buildings in this area. Next door is a graduate student coop. They have dinners outside when the weather is nice. Because the cottage is in the back most of the undergraduate student noise is not intrusive. 

The owner is dedicated to provided the best housing possible and is responsive to all repair requests. 

Financial aspect: Rent is $2895 with a two month deposit. This rent is for two people or a couple with a child. Add $250 for an additional person. The lease term is from June 1, 2016 through July 31, 2017. Utilities are paid by tenant. A coveted off street parking spot is available for $100 per month. No smoking or pets. Due to allergies, absolutely no cats. Email Michelle with a little information about yourself if you are interested. 

Note: the furnishings change from time to time and may be different from those in the pictures.

Property Description 


1568 Campus Drive is one of our most unique properties. The property is located on a lush green hillside and is nestled under eucalyptus trees. This 4000 square foot house offers 4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms and it can be rented out as two separate floors. This house has a beautiful view of the San Francisco Bay from the decks. As an added bonus, there is a carport that allows 4 cars parked tandem, as well as plenty of street parking. The main level of the house features a formal living room and dining room, both are warm and inviting for family and friends. For a lazy Sunday breakfast you can lounge in the eat-in kitchen with its beautiful granite counter tops and gas stove. Clean up is a cinch with a dishwasher and garbage disposal. The lower floor features a full kitchen, laundry, master bedrooms suite and two additional rooms. It's like a separate house all in itself.


This Spectacular 4 bedroom 3 bathroom home is perched on top of the Berkeley Hills directly behind the Lawrence Berkeley Lab and Near the Hall of Science. Campus Drive is a quiet cul-de-sac street near several local parks, as well as Tilden Regional Park. It is also a 7 minute drive to downtown Berkeley and the Cal Campus. It is a wonderful neighborhood.
The huge home has everything.On the first level, there is a huge formal living room, dining room, eat-in kitchen, laundry room and huge guest room with its own bathroom. The kitchen has a gas stove with self-cleaning oven, microwave, fridge, dishwasher, disposal, and large pantry. There are beautiful granite counter tops and large windows. Finally there is a large front deck surround by Eucalyptus Trees and Huge Rear Decks with Views of the Bay.
Upstairs, there is a huge family room surrounded by a gigantic master suite with tile bathroom and jacuzzi tub. There are two additional over sized bedrooms and a small deck facing the bay view.

Neighborhood Information
Neighborhood Description 


This tucked away area of the Berkeley Hills has the benefits of city life with none of the noise and congestion, making it arguably one of the best locations in the Berkeley! You will discover Cal Campus is just a short trip down the hill, walk bike or drive there in minutes. Access to the 65 bus line at Grizzly Peak is a short walk up the hill. Tilden Park, Lawrence Hall of Science, and Berkeley's prized Rose Garden are all just a stone's throw from this location. Shopping is available at Andronicos and Safeway Markets just off Cedar St. Get ready to be amazed at the selection of bakeries, farmers markets, cafes and fine dining, it's what the Berkeley locals call the "Gourmet Ghetto". BART is close, located right in Downtown Berkeley. If one word could describe the neighborhood it would be: Premium!
